meanings.definition: The action of clearing or approving something in advance.
meanings.sent1: The airport security conducted a preclearance of all passengers before boarding the plane.
meanings.sent2: The customs officer gave preclearance to the shipment of goods before they were allowed to enter the country.
meanings.sent3: The preclearance of the document was like getting a stamp of approval before the big presentation.
meanings.sent4: She felt a sense of relief when she received preclearance for her visa application, like a weight lifted off her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The preclearance process was like a golden ticket to skip the long line at the amusement park.

meanings.definition: The process of inspecting or checking something before it is allowed to proceed.
meanings.sent1: The preclearance of the equipment ensured that it met all safety standards before being used.
meanings.sent2: The preclearance of the documents was necessary to avoid any errors in the final report.
meanings.sent3: The preclearance of the ingredients in the recipe was like a chef double-checking all the measurements.
meanings.sent4: The preclearance of the package was like a security check to make sure nothing harmful was inside.
meanings.sent5: The preclearance process was as thorough as a detective investigating a crime scene.
